document.title: Reflection and an Appetite for Experience: Theory to Classroom Practice
document.abstract: Reflection promotes an openness to thinking and an appetite for experience that must ground everyday classroom practice.
document.publication-title: The Journal of the Assembly for Expanded Perspectives on Learning

field.name: acknowledgements
field.value: Dr. Judith Halden-Sullivan is an associate professor of English at the State University of West Georgia, where she serves as Director of Writing. She has a Ph.D. in English from the Pennsylvania State University; contemporary American poetry, phenomenology, and composition/rhetoric are the specific areas in which she has published. She currently is preparing a study that emplaces Gadamer s dialectic of experience within the context of composition studies and the teaching of writing.
